SEARCH
Package net.chaossquad.mclib.blocks

Klasse BlockBox

java.lang.Object
net.chaossquad.mclib.blocks.BlockBox
public class BlockBox extends Object
Does the same as a BoundingBox, but for blocks. This was created because the BoundingBox does not include the end block in the contains method. Use this when you are working with blocks and BoundingBox when you are not working with blocks. Both objects can be converted into each other.

  • Verschachtelte Klassen - Übersicht

    Klasse

    BlockBox.BlockLocationProvider
    An interface which provides the coordinates for forEach(BlockLocationProvider).

    BlockBox(org.bukkit.Location l)
    Creates a block box containing a single block at the specified location.
    BlockBox(org.bukkit.Location min, org.bukkit.Location max)
    Creates a block box containing all blocks between the specified locations.
    BlockBox(org.bukkit.util.BoundingBox boundingBox)
    Creates a block box from a BoundingBox using its block coordinates.
    BlockBox(org.bukkit.util.Vector location)
    Creates a block box containing a single block at the specified location vector.
    BlockBox(org.bukkit.util.Vector min, org.bukkit.util.Vector max)
    Creates a block box containing all blocks between the specified location vectors.

    • sort

      public void sort()
      Sorts the min and max coordinates. This will make the min location the location with the lowest coordinates and the max location the location with the highest coordinates. It makes sense to use this if you are planning to iterate through this block box.

    • forEach

      public void forEach(BlockBox.BlockLocationProvider locationProvider)
      Iterates through every single block in the BlockBox.
      Parameter:
      locationProvider - location provider
